column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

The ambiance and the food here is great . This place is good for a romantic date night. The service was prompted too! We had the Moscow mule and the pink drink (forgot the name) both mocktails. Then we had the appetizer , eggplant and lobster bisque. Both were very delicious. Next we had the truffle  pasta cooked in cheese wheel right in front of us. That was out of the world good! But a bit on the heavy side. After we had the chicken parm and Branzino fish (entrees ) and lastly the two desserts (tiramisu and layered cake).

Osteria Brooklyn is an Italian restaurant in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn New York. A warm and cozy setting that sets the mood for an authentic Italian eatery. It was founded by Executive Chef Raffaele Solinas. Chef Solinas came to New York City with a suitcase packed with 45 knives and a heart mission that was ready to cook. He started his culinary journey in Sardinia. He later moved to Manhattan where he worked his way towards success. Chef Solinas has a great knowledge of Italian cuisine and the trends of the New York City market. His establishment is well recognized and genuinely favorable. How was it?:  I had the "Clinton Hill" cocktail, made with tequila, pineapple, and lime. The lime itself was literally set on fire and left for me to blow out. I also had the "House Specialty Fried Oysters". A fried oyster and zucchini appetizer topped with bourbon tartare sauce. For the entree I had the "Pappardelle and Ossobuco", made with lamb shank, goat cheese, and pestata. So delicious! The lamb was cooked to perfection over pappardelle, a tomato-like sauce, and crumbles of goat cheese to finish
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Honestly probably one of my top favorite authentic Italian restaurants. I was mind blown with the fettuccine osteria the first time i had it (literally went back a week later) so flavorful and i love that they cook it right in front of you. Everything was delicious. The dessert menu is amazing they have all desserts at display. The place super cute and chill. Everyone was very attentive service was great. 10/10
No comment
No comment

From the moment you walk in everything is amazing. The truffle pasta is absolutely incredible. It's a must have don't even think just order it. The grilled calamari was seasoned perfectly on the risotto under it was pure magic. I don't know how they do it,. This is definitely one of my new favorites. The staff is so attentive they go out of their way to make you feel welcome.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My 1st visit here today at lunch. Beautiful place, nice warm welcome, good energy, friendly and attentive service. Well trained staff. Decor: love it! Food: Distinctly made and presented ‼ Every course was eye catching. This place defines flavors and hospitality‼ Worth visiting all the way from Queens taking a train and then a looong walk to the restaurant ‼ Well spent day-off‼ Kudos to the Chef and team‼‼ GRAZIE.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

The food was delicious the steak was juicy and very flavorful I usually need steak sauce but did not ask for any. We also ordered the pasta dish with shrimp and mussels I believe also delicious. Only thing was the shrimp cocktail was pricey for the small shrimp they give but other than that I will return. Service was amazing they were very attentive and I love that , the place is tight somewhat but it feels at home  it's beautiful inside
No comment

Came here with a friend for my birthday on the weekend and it was pretty busy. But No reservation needed and we were seated with a few minutes. The sauce with the starter bread was already amazing before we even ordered food. The risotto was so creamy and flavorful and the portion was pretty big. The staff was really nice and accommodating. 10/10 would recommend for cosy and classy dates or a nice dinner with friends.

The place is really good. Service was good . If you want a good experience as far as presentation come here it's cool . The food is just as good. The drinks are well crafted . The wine infused pasta was amazing and the zuppa de pesce was great. The place is a great spot for date night as well. Enjoy if you go.

Wow. This was a last minute birthday find and  I must say this place exceeded all expectations. We had the tuna tarter (4/5), fried oysters (5/5), fritto misto (5/5), shrimp ceviche (4/5), fettuccini Osteria (200/5) - MUST HAVE. The drinks were also really good. Will certainly be back to this Brooklyn gem.
No comment

My friends and I came here to have dinner on a weekday evening. We were in the mood for Italian and none of us had been here but heard good things about it so we decided to give it a try. We had made a reservation prior, which I'd recommend since it seems to be always busy. When we were seated we realized that the air conditioning system wasn't working - however this obviously seems like a temporary issue. i'd call beforehand just to make sure. When it came time to order we decided to split a bottle of wine for the table and I ordered a carbonara pizza ($19). The service here was a bit slow but again, it may have been due to the dinner rush. Overall I'd come here again, however call and prepare beforehand.

Such a cute spot for Italian food, l love the ambiance here, cozy and elegant, and the service was great, the food and drinks came fast. Everything we tired were excellent. Branzino, fettuccine osteria and flat Bread with Sheep Ricotta and Spicy Honey are must to have. I'll be back to try more.

I'm such a fan of Osteria Brooklyn! It's such a cute spot to grab food or even for a date night. My favorite items on the menu have to be the Burrata & Prosciutto (Wrapped in Prosciutto, Sun Dried Tomatoes Red Wine Figs) and the Fettuccine  Osteria (House Specialty "Table Side" Red Wine Infused Pasta, white Truffle Sauce, Seasonal Truffle). The staff is super friendly and the food is always delicious! I would definitely recommend giving them a try. For more reviews check out my Instagram EmmesEverydayEats on Instagram.
No comment

If you're making the trek to Brooklyn from Long Island, then you will appreciate the welcoming and accommodating staff, the yummy food and the fun vibe. We were here on a Sunday afternoon so traffic wasn't too horrible and we were able to find relatively close parking. They have a nice brunch menu, we got a basket of baked goods with a trio of spreads, a spicy jam, ricotta and eggplant. The combination of the spicy Jam and ricotta on a croissant was perfect! Of course our group went straight for the regular menu. We tried so much in the menu as we were with a large group and one person ordered a bunch of dishes for all of us to be shared. There was so much so it would take forever to describe each dish. Suffice it to say, I went home happily satisfied with every bite.

Everything here was really delicious. Authentic taste , rich flavors, and great service. The wait staff was extremely helpful and walked us through the menu. All of our God was also sold in a really timely mannor. We didn't wait too long inbetween meals. I loved the octopus. Nice firm texture. The gnocchi was buttery and light. There was another pasta I got that was so good! The sauce was buttery and savor. I ate this one slow to really enjoy it. Can't wait to come back!
No comment
Had such a lovely girls dinner here! The portions were big and good for sharing and the wine infused pasta tossed in the cheese wheel table side was unmissable! Will be back for a date night soon!
No comment

The best thing on this menu was my aperol spritz. For starters we ordered, the fritto misto, oysters & caprese salad. The tomatoes in the salad were soggy & didn't seem fresh. The mozzarella was a weird texture. In the fritto misto the calamari was overcooked & they had 3 pieces of shrimp, literally! I ordered the spinach ravioli and it was nasty, the spinach overpowered the whole thing it was so unflavored. The worst Italian food I've ever tasted.
No comment
No comment

i went here with some friends and sadly was unimpressed by the food and service. the food was okay but nothing special - there are far better italian restaurants in the city to try. perhaps i went on an off night, who knows. but i wouldn't go back.
The owner is rude and treats his workers with no respect!  I will never patron this place again.

DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS GARBAGE DUMP. I can't even believe that in one order of pasta, there was not only a disgusting hair in my food but also a piece of paper good and blended into my dish. What the hell are they doing in that kitchen????

I made sure to YELP this restaurant before ordering from Postmates and I have to say I am highly disappointed. I got the meatballs and spaghetti. The food was so bland and no flavor. The meatball were so small ( well they did say mini). Either way it was not flavorful at all. I expected to taste a better sauce, a better meatball and some garlic. I must say I would never order from here again.

This gem near Downtown Brooklyn has been a great find and I must say the customer service in here is amazing. They always greet you and suggest things plus give you a little goodie treat along the way out which is nice. The food here is delcious too. The pasta with truffles taste spectacular and they aren't cheap on the truffle which is a bonus. It's also fun watching them toss the pasta into the giant cheese to melt it and serve it on your plate. I have yet to try their brunch yet but can't wait.

Osteria Brooklyn is such a gem in BK! I stopped in for brunch & had a lovely experience. The outdoor dining is BEAUTIFUL and super cozy. Besides the front outdoor dining, they also have an adorable back patio. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. We loved the brunch basket that arrived at the table-- filled with complimentary croissants, bread, and muffins. Their steak and eggs was one of the best I've ever had. The steak was very high-quality and super juicy. Their pancakes were also very unique and delicious. I highly recommend this adorable restaurant and I can't wait to come back for dinner service!

Omgggggg it's the best parpadelli I ever had in my life. Their pasta is amazing and they totally worth what u pay for. I live 1 min away from this place so my food gets always delivered super warm and it's as good as I eat it at the Restuarant.
No comment

this place was honestly fantastic!! service was amazing, every single pasta dish was sooo delicious (special shout-out to the fettuccine osteria) and the fried oyster app with zucchini fries was perfect. our servers took really good care of us, brought out some delicious rum drinks and looked so cute in their matching hats. would definitely come back!
No comment
Great vibe and great service. Selections were delicious as well. We came with a large group and tried a little bit of everything. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in town.
No comment
No comment

I had a wonderful meal today. I picked this venue to celebrate my mother's and sister's birthday. Everyone enjoyed their meal. Staff was friendly and accommodating. I would definitely visit again. Thank you.

This was some of the best Italian food I've had in a long time. The fried oysters appetizer was incredible and the pasta bolognese was up there with the best that I've had. I'll definitely be back and look forward to trying more of the menu!
No comment

Came here for dinner and had high expectations for the food considering the great ratings on social media.  The place is cute and staff very friendly but the food was mediocre.  We had the shrimp cerviche to start and it was mostly avocado and lacked flavor.  For my entree I had the branzino which was good but a bit over cooked and dry. As for the dessert which was advertised as a chocolate soufflé which I'm expecting to be light and airy, it turned out to be a dry chocolate cake.  Thank goodness there was gelato on top to give it more moisture.  Overall, I think the food was ok but wouldn't go out of my way to go back since there are so many better Italian restaurants in Brooklyn.

column1: Real Foodies Of New York K.
column6: LOVED THIS SPOT!! Would have to say this is one of the best restaurants in the area. Had a really welcoming and warm family experience here and the food quality was amazing with reasonable pricing. Super quick service too. It was really busy so I definitely suggest making a reservation. Would recommend to a friend and will be returning!! :)
Delicious food & friendly staff make this restaurant a must try. We'll be coming back soon.
No comment
No comment

We had been here a long time ago when it was a different restaurant.  Really enjoyed the new food and it seems like a significant improvement in the menu.  Had the House Special - spaghetti Fra Diavolo which was pretty good.  the only problem with it was that it was supposed to be spicy (or at least it is every where else I have ordered it) and this had no spice what so ever.  But the pasta and seafood in it were good.  My wife had the branzino, which was pretty good and it came with squash and potatoes in a great sauce.  Would definitely come back.  Enjoyed the italian soda as well, but at $8 a bottle it is a little pricey for a non-alcoholic drink.  also is kid friendly.

We had an amazing dinner here on a Saturday night.  Burrata app! Spaghetti Diavolo, and Lamb shank Ossobuco. Absolutely delicious! The vanilla cake was the perfect ending. Service was impeccable.  Highly recommend!

We had a family celebration here today. Great outdoor dining. I had the lamb pappardelle, and my only complaint was "why waste the sharp knife?" The lamb fell apart at the touch of a fork. So delicious. Highly recommended!

What an incredibly special dining experience. You can tell that the chef and his team love to serve and entertain with love and passion. The food here is incredible and well presented. My absolute favorites had to be the Fettucine with truffles in the cheese wheel, the risotto with mushrooms and scallops and the cod. You absolutely cannot miss with anything here. Everything is incredible. I cannot wait to go back. I will dream of the truffle pasta forever
No comment
AMAZING SPOT! Finally had a chance to try this place after walking by it so many times, and the food was absolutely delightful as well as the service. Super friendly staff, great food, great vibes.
No comment

Love the penne vodka here! Have been here a few times and noticed they don't have penne vodka on the menu, but will make it upon request. I get it with grilled chicken added and it's delicious! You also get bread for the table that comes with a red sauce (not sure what if is) to dip in and it's delicious! The drinks are also great. Will try the cacio de Pepe next time as the waitress recommended it!
No comment

Food is great and a good variety of dishes to choose from.  They are good at accommodating changes or dietary needs which is awesome. Love the pasta with beef ragu, the lightly fried calamari is awesome and comes with fried shrimp and zucchini.  Service is pretty quick and food is delicious.  I also order lunch to go sometimes and Be sure to ask for the great lunch specials that are reasonably priced and come with appetizer & entree.  Overall a good option

Had very high hopes for this place as the ambiance and food looked amazing on social media. However, my friend and I did not get to try anything as we had to leave because the service was absolutely horrible. The host (I assume he is the owner because he is pictured all over their Instagram) was a complete A-hole. From the start he was very sarcastic and I had brushed it off as it being part of his character. But it turned out there had to be some issue against us and I don't know why. We came in without a reservation and understandably waited for bit of time. When he had let 3 other groups (1 of which was the same party size as us) in without a reservation it felt personal so we left. A very mean man.
No comment

This has to be one of if not my favorite restaurant! Staff is incredibly nice and the food is out of this world. Took my girlfriend there and our meals were absolutely delicious. I got a carbonara and my girl got a crab ravioli dish - impeccable! I strongly recommend getting the blood orange Italian soda too! I wish I could get cases of the stuff to bring home. Then we got dessert, and the options were almost impossible to choose from, they all looked amazing, but we got the cannolis and a panna cotta - absolutely to die for! A crew member named Alex was the nicest guy too! He gave us two free shots on the house and treated us like gold. Was my fifth time going and it certainly won't be my last! Love this place and couldn't recommend it any more!   - Rob

This little gem is worth the reservations. The food was amazing, service was impeccable, drinks were a art form with a fantastic mixologist, and definitely will return. The food is truly made with love and the drinks are from talent. I would bring a business or date here. The outside area is covered with bright sunlight. I am definitely returning for the fantastic drink, service and food.

Last night we decided to try Osteria Brooklyn for the first time and we could not be happier with the experience! Everything about this restaurant was amazing, from the staff to the ambience to the food. Alex made us feel right at home and meeting the chef was a delight. I honestly can't even properly say how much I loved it here. The drinks and the food were simply exquisite. We will definitely be going back and I most definitely recommend you go if you can!
No comment

Hands down the BEST restaurant in the entire city. The service was impeccable, the staff was amazing and kind and accommodating, and the owner was fantastic and I loved how he was working just as hard (if not harder) than anyone else. At the end of the night the bartender brought everyone limoncello shots and a waitress handed out baked goods that came from the cutest basket. And the food was to die for. 12/10!!!

We had a fantastic experience having our wedding hosted by Osteria Brooklyn. It was their first wedding, but we would never have known if they hadn't told us! From the very first time we went in, all the way up through the time we left at the end, we were well taken care of, and that's everything! The food was absolutely delicious, the cocktails were so good, the service was seamless and kind, and it couldn't have gone better. You should go here for dinner when relatives are visiting, or when you just want to go somewhere nice, or if you want to host your own micro wedding (we had 15 people, if you're curious). You won't be disappointed!
No comment

This place was recommended by multiple people, so we made sure to have dinner here. My only regret is that we weren't hungrier--we could only manage two entrees, no wine or appetizers. It's a beautiful place to eat in the evening, and it has a good number of outdoor tables. My risotto wasn't the creamiest I've ever had, but it WAS the most flavorful. The other entree was an usual shape of pasta with Italian sausage and ricotta, and my husband raved about it. We'll be back!

My favorite Italian place! The food is delightful! It's always a great experience at OSTERIA! You must try their red wine infused pasta! It's to die for! Follow my IG content of my experience! @pinksvibez

The drinks are good. The tapas are good. I enjoyed every app: Grilled octopus, the grilled calamari, the burrata platter, the pizza Rustica and the Four Season pizza. I ordered caesar salad with shrimps, but my server forgot it. I did get it eventually after asking for it. I came here after drooling over their instagram posts. Im obsessed with truffles, I wanted so badly to eat the fettuccini and experience the table side cheese wheel--but my server never did it. Its written on the menu, (table side)-- what a bust. I was so disappointed. You cant even say it wasnt done because it was busy--the other server did it for his table. The infamous pasta tasted like truffle oil-infused milk. It needed that salt from the cheese to bring out the flavor. Anyway- Id go back if I was in the area for the drinks maybe. But dont be fooled by their instagram. I wouldnt go out of my way to come back for $$$$$ in appetizers.

All I can say was, everything I mean everything from the apps to the drinks to the main course was PERFECT! delicioso  kisses to the chef...the oyster were freshhh! Satisfied feeling..if your looking for some authentic Italian style food..this is it..a low key spot you'll forget your in Brooklyn..! Everything came out on time, the staff was very nice and attentive.. I'll definitely be coming back here with hubby..

Whatta feast! We had a great experience having dinner on a Thursday night-- cute ambiance, friendly staff and stellar menu. The drinks came out looking beautiful, one of them was literally on fire. We both loved the taste, not overly strong and nice accompaniment to the rest of dinner. The fresh bread came to the table almost immediately and it was piping hot! Of the appetizers, my absolute favorite was Fritto Misto which has Fried Calamari, Shrimp, Zucchini. This is SUPERB showcasing fresh and crispy seafood, but I also loved the addition of the fried zucchini. It comes with a nice spicy red sauce for dipping which is personally a must have for fried calamari for me! As for entrees: the red wine fettuccine pasta and zuppa di pesce stole the show. The pasta dish has a rich sauce on homemade pasta with shaved fresh truffle. The zuppa is a show with a spectacular dish hiding under this peel away bread. The sauce again is so flavorful with a depth of tomatoe-y flavor. This is the dish for seafood lovers! Don't even get me started on the dessert- meringue cake was so light, and tasty.
No comment
Excellent food with a great variety to choose from and the service is friendly and professional.
Really good place!. Close to where I libe, food was delicious. We had a really good time.
Delicious Italian food in Clinton Hill/Fort Greene. Outdoor seating is spacious and the wait staff is highly attentive.
Fabulous food, service and ambiance. Calamari appetizer was scrumptious. Definitely a place to go back to
No comment
No comment

Seriously - not only great/fresh seafood but the best customer service my boyfriend had I have had in a long time. Our service was great (I forget her name) and Alex was FANTASTIC. From greeting us to checking on us and recommendations, he was so attentive. Our table even had a slight wobble and he ran to fix it! Lol. Would definitely come back, food and service was spot on

I had dinner here this week.  I ordered the linguini vongole. The staff is super friendly accommodating. Our waiter was new and in training. He mistakenly gave me the wrong dish and the owner/manager offered to pack it up for me to take home for lunch the next day. That dish was equally delicious. Definitely recommended for a nice sit down spot if you're looking for delicious Italian food.
No comment
No comment

Came here on Columbus day Monday for lunch around 2pm the fresh bread was good I ordered the pizza and wine infused pasta that says on the menu it would be made   table side and it was not so I was disappointed because I came here expecting the full experience

I've visited Osteria three times now and generally had fairly positive experiences, but unfortunately had to knock it down 1 star for my last visit. To start with the positive, I had been before for a Valentine's dinner this year when things were starting to open up and we were able to do indoor dining. Great! The food was excellent, service was good, and it was nice to feel normal and eat inside on a cold night. Visited another time and also had a similar experience. I was even saying to my partner that for our area, Osteria is definitely my go-to nice Italian restaurant for dinner. Unfortunately my last experience wasn't nearly as satisfying but I will give the benefit of the doubt because something was definitely off. Our server seemed out of her element, like maybe she was a hostess who was asked to wait tables due to someone calling out? We ordered a carafe of the Osteria cocktail which the server didn't seem to understand. Even after pointing to it on the menu she seemed somewhat confused. It wasn't until I believe the owner/chef came over and clarified with us that we got the drinks, which were tasty. We ordered two appetizers and ultimately ended up not receiving one of them.. it was forgotten and thankfully not included on the bill, but that was somewhat disappointing. Then we asked another server (who also seemed out of his element) for more bread which never came. The pasta dishes we ordered were very tasty! I have no complaints about the food as it is always delicious, but something was definitely off the last time I visited which [figuratively] left a bad taste in my mouth. I would like to return again in the future to give Osteria another chance as my first two visits were very positive, but if this had been my first visit I would likely not return.
The margarita pizza is a must!! Awesome service. I ordered the penne bolognaise and it was delicious. Great Brooklyn restaurant. We ate out side and had a blast.

Incredible experience! The food was outstanding and the service was impeccable - Alex and his team were prompt, super warm and recommended the best things to try. We had the truffle fettuccine osteria and it was SPECTACULAR. We also had the octopus and the beet salad - YUM. The tiramisu and the vanilla merengue cake - please someone come get me!! It was SO GOOD. Coming back again! Thank you guys!
No comment
No comment

I highly recommend Osteria Brooklyn, they offer fantastic dishes with fresh tasting ingredients. Make sure you go hungry because they have an extensive array of menu options, don't forget to leave some room for desserts! Incredible atmosphere, attentive friendly staff, I can't wait to go back!
Such a good Italian place! We ordered the Crab stuffed ravioli and my stomach is growling now writing this. Highly recommend any and all of their pasta dishes and their pizzas are phenomenal as well.

Me and my bestie came here for dinner and let's just say this hidden gem is our our new favorite Italian restaurant. The chef treats everyone as they are a vip customer. The drinks are tasty and strong just how I like them. The food is amazing our favorite dish is the red fettuccine it's a must have

Not sure if the kitchen was having an off day in the seasoning department but the gnocchi al pesto was very bland, like milk with a tinge of pesto... The spaghetti and meatball was on the watery side in terms of sauce and the meat balls were decent. Also the ricotta and spinach ravioli was reminiscent of a ravioli brand from Costco... not sure if they just made it very similar to a pre-made brand or what may be going on. Had high hopes for this place but wound up being a huge disappointment. $22 and up for each of these dishes wow. Money not well spent.
No comment

The food we had tonight was delicious but we were served a bottle of wine that was clearly a bottle that has been refilled with another wine. It had wine stains on the label and the label on the back was torn. It also wasn't the wine we ordered. The foil had already been cut before it came to the table. When we asked about the server said it was because the wine attendant was clumsy and had spilled wine all over. The table next to us was served a bottle of wine that was also clearly not sealed. When we asked our waiter he said he would ask and they only charged us for two glasses of house wine. I suspect this place is refilling bottles of wine with house jug wine and trying to get away with charging higher prices.

Such a homey and cute restaurant. As soon as you walk in you immediately feel like you are in Italy . The food did not disappoint. Grilled calamari, lasagna and pizza were all really good. Portion is not large but enough to fill you and share a few bites with others. Prices are on the higher side and you get charged 4% if you pay with credit card so bring enough cash . Service was not the greatest as they took longer to bring our food out then with other tables who arrived after us .
No comment

I made our reservation a week before traveling to NY from Portland, Oregon. To say that I was counting the minutes until this meal would not be an exaggeration! I first had a meal at Osteria Brooklyn in May 2022. That meal was the finest Italian food I have ever enjoyed (and I have had some amazing meals in Italy). Last May, I had two (repeat TWO) salads and lasagna. The caesar was a 10 out of 10 and the Pear/Spinach (INSALATINA DI SPINACI) salad was a 10 out of 10. Then the lasagna... Okay - their lasagna was truly NEXT LEVEL EPIC. Now, fast forward, I'm back. Just enjoyed another over the top meal last night (late Aug. 2022). (Note: It is honestly painful to write this since I already finished my leftover lasagna and THEIR lasagna remains my all-time favorite Italian meal.) This visit, I tried a new salad (a sign that I really trust their menu - I am the type that sticks with a proven thing for years before exploring the menu). Last night I tried the apple salad (OSTERIA SPECIAL APPLE SALAD) - okay - another winner! I also tried the beef meatball appetizer served atop polenta which had a euphoric combination of cheeses whipped into it. Amazing. I think anyone reading this will get the point - this place has won my heart. There are no restaurants that come close to delighting me in Portland, Oregon to the level that Osteria Brooklyn ranks. THANK you for another great meal! Next time I must try whatever you are creating in that huge round of cheese. I saw two table-side preparations with fire emanating from a cheese round - YES yelp reader, the pasta was being prepped in a cheese round! Thank you Osteria Brooklyn - I can't wait to come back even if it means I must move my son out of his college dorm just to dine with you! Sitting down to a meal at your restaurant was the prize for moving my son out and into his college dorm. My son goes to Pratt and I go to Osteria Brooklyn! I say that's a win win. Thanks for being so delicious. Your vibe is great and I find it's a major comfort to dine with you. Note: No photos. This meal was just something to internalize -- I had no interest in taking pictures! Just a joy to enjoy in the moment.
Wonderful experience. The atmosphere, service, and food were all top notch. Alex and Diego were soo kind and attentive. I will definitely recommend and return. Pricey but you get what you pay for.

Highly recommend the house pasta. Alex is an absolute gem. Trusted his recommendations and they did not disappoint.  Friendly, attentive, and great food most of all. We had the watermelon corn salad  + Osteria pasta with shrimp and the Apple salad * lasagna.

What a treasure!  We felt welcomed the moment we stepped in the lovely space. The food was divine and the service was just what we love, relaxed yet attentive.  It was a superb neighborhood bistro and I'm so happy we found it. You will not be disappointed.

I am a repeat customer and I LOVE this place. No other Italian restaurant will do it for me, everything is exquisite. The chef, Raffaele, puts his soul into all the dishes and it shows. Must come and try, everything on the menu is wonderful, will not disappoint.
No comment

First timer here and my experience was lovely! The staff was very attentive to our needs, and the food overall was delicious. Enjoyed their burrata and the pastas they had! It was also my birthday and they made it beyond special with the dessert and drinks! Would definitely come back. Shoutout to Chef Raffaele!
No comment

Osteria is one of my restaurants in Brooklyn! Why you ask? Well, the food is absolutely delicious but the staff warms my heart. They are extremely friendly and welcoming, even on busy nights. They work their asses off to make sure everyone has a great dining experience! The owner is great but the staff, amazing customer service. Cheers Osteria!
Amazing italian restaurant with a great selection of antipasto and entree . Bravo !!!!!
No comment

All staff were lovely and attentive. Immediately greeted with fresh warm bread, the cocktails came out quickly and were fun and good. the ribeye and pesto gnocchi were tasty and cooked well. Would recommend the bread pudding as well! Overall great service and food and vibes overall!

After a day hot day, have some sparkling drink, my friend don't drink but all service was great, we want order the hole menu because everything was just great! We order just 2 different entrees to start and our main course was just amazing lamb we will come back for more.
No comment
I had the octopus and shrimp appetizers and they  were amazing! I would 100% recommend! The server, management and venue was amazing!
No comment

What an extraordinary place! Outdoor dining was actually pleasant even in 25 degree weather! It was about 10 degrees warmer inside the charming structure they built. I brought a blanket to put over my shoulders after I took my coat off. The food was exquisite! We started with the fried with zucchini and burrata and fig salad. Then moved on to eggplant rollatini and the short ribs with polenta. We could not resist the meringue vanilla cake which was out of this world! The treat was getting to meet the chef, Raphaele! A a man at the table next to ours traveled 2 hours from the North Fork because he new of this chef when he was in Long Island City and said the trip was worth it! Bravo, for the courage Chef Rafaele had to open this restaurant during the pandemic. I highly recommend and don't be afraid of the cold, to eat outside. It was delightful and made me feel like I was in Europe.

Came here for a girls night.... the management and waitress were very nice! That's one. I always get weary when I go to a gentrified restaurant because of the height of racism. But they made us feel welcomed. The waitress was too cool and very hospitable! I wish I remembered her name. We were seated in the greenhouse such a pleasant area. The drinks were delicious, not overpowering but def did the job. Food presentation was beautiful! But better yet, it was soooo good! I will be returning. More than likely for a date night

This place is incredible. We've been here for brunch and dinner and have only had 5 star experiences--from the service, the food, and the wine:cocktails. This is the spot for really delicious, authentic Italian food in a beautiful outdoor (during COVID) setting. The gnocchi in truffle sauce is a dinner highlight. We loved the complimentary pastry basket during brunch (great croissants, muffins). The lemon ricotta pancakes were really great. Honestly, I can't say enough good things about this place. Highly recommended. I also think the menu is very reasonably priced considering the quality.
Restaurant is amazing, the food i phenomenal every time and Alex is the best waiter, request him!!!!

We have eaten here twice and loved it both times. The food is really good. Great flavors, a wide variety of options and many dishes off the beaten path of your usual Italian offering.  The drinks are made well and the ambience is quite pleasant. Music and outdoor seating. The staff are professional and the food came in a reasonable amount of time.
No comment

This is an amazing new neighborhood gem! We were looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary, and the vibe of Osteria called to us! Their outdoor space is beautiful, the food is some of the most delicious Italian food I've had since our Italian honeymoon, and everyone, from the head chef to the staff, is wonderful. Will definitely be going back as much as we can!
Great tasting pizzas. We have ordered takeout and eaten out at this restaurant and both times we were very satisfied

This place is amazing. Stopped by for outdoor dining a couple weeks ago as we've noticed they recently opened and had a lovely outdoor area set up on myrtle. When we arrived we were lucky to be seated in their garden in the back which was even more lovely since it was more quiet and intimate. This was our last meal out before I gave birth so we went all out and got appetizers, mains, and dessert and this was one of the best meals we have had in a while.  Portion sizes and pricing was on point and everything we had was delicious. Started with breaded squid (must get!), veal pappardelle for main which came with a massive shank on top (partner had a truffle wine pasta dont remember the name but he enjoyed it), and a huge slice of meringue cake. Love how they bring out all of the desserts so you can have a look at what you want. Can't wait to come back!
Great customer service. Nice atmosphere. Good food + drinks! Will definitely come back when it's warmer.
No comment

Yum!!!! Handmade, elegant, elevated Italian.  We had the truffle gnocchi and scallop and mushroom risotto and best from bedsty to downtown brooklyn.   The service was lovely and if you want to feel part of the neighborhood not just a patron.  Come check them out.  It's worth the trip to Clinton Hill.

We'd give it 6 stars if we could. This place recreates the true dining experience during these strange and difficult times. Not only are they doing outdoor dining out front, but they have a full backyard garden away from the hustle and bustle of the street.  It was our first time, but after the first bite of salmon tartare, we knew we made the right choice! My fiancée's lamb shank pappardelle was enough for two (at least)!! My spaghetti frutti di mare was possibly the best I've ever had, and that's a huge compliment considering it's my favorite dish! I don't know how we had room for dessert, but I think her face says it all: STAHP. YOU HAVE TO TASTE THIS BREAD PUDDING. ITS FRIGGIN' INCREDIBLE.

Went for Christmas dinner with my family.  Very charming decor, attentive staff (&owner) and good music playing.  Two of us are vegans and the owner didn't skip a beat in making any accommodations we requested.  I actually had him surprise me a "vegan" pasta dish that was amazing.  Food was amazing from beginning to end and it all made for a wonderful night. Only to be completed with limoncellos on the house. We'll be back for sure~
My new favorite dinner spot! The food and staff are an absolute delight!! Also try the "Kendra" cocktail!!! It's named after one of their best waitresses.
I ordered the pappardelle d'agnello it was so good!!! I will order this plate again, the waiting time wasn't long, we're Dominican and 100% recommended this place

Absolutely the best! My husband and I live in the neighborhood and we come here often. Their food and service is consistently outstanding!  It really feels like home and every time we visit, it's a warm warm welcome.
The experience here was surprisingly wonderful. Our waiter was attentive and friendly, the wine was exceptional and the Caesar salad was the best I've ever had

I am touring colleges right now, August 20th, 2021, and my mother and I were quite hungry. Normally, we eat at major chain restaurants like Panera and Burger King, but we wanted to try something new. If you are like us, this is the perfect place to go. Friendly staff and food comes quicker than anywhere I've been. It's outdoor dining in the summer is aesthetic and it's demeanor embodies the Italian roots with authentic soda and an Italian chef. I highly recommend.
Excellent place, great service and delicious food. I highly recommend Osteria Brooklyn, amazing place!!!

Amazing food! Literally never disappoints. Staff is also so nice and we always have a great time. Highly Recommend the meat and cheese platter, the veal Milanese is incredible, all the pastas are delicious and the seafood is perfect. Make sure to save room for dessert too!

Tonight I felt there was cameras on us and we were being pranked.I Have been here twice with my family before tonight and we loved it. Same male server came out to us tonight ( we were outside because we had our dog there), the male server psyched himself up behind my husband, in full view of my son and I, to talk to us, then saw our dog , proceeded to tell us he worked "in the narcotics division" and showed us a fake toy button pretending it was a police badge. All with a straight face. We let that go. We ordered. My husband ordered first. He then turned to my husband 2 seconds later and said "and for you?"., er he's the only one that ordered. He took the order and walked away, without the menus , but tripping up as he went. He then came back a few mins later and said "are you ready to order?". We said we just did. He walked away. A few minutes later a young white girl came out, took my order ( again), walked back in then came out and said "sorry can I take the full order he didn't get it", we said yup, we knew it, he's so high. Eventually we get out meals, one of them not correct but at this stage we were amazed we actually got food. Another girl took over , my son and husband ordered second beers, I declined. When we got the bill, I wrote on the bill, no tip as the guy was so high, he didn't even know he'd talked to us, twice! In 15 mins!!! I also wrote the young girl saved him. We were the only people eating outside. With few people inside. As we got up to leave, another guy came out, obviously trying to smooth this farce over, I asked if he's the manager. Twice. He appeared just as high, but claimed he was the chef ( in the same  black tshirt as the servers?) I said the food was great but the male server is a joke, he was way too high to be front of house. The "chef", just replied "wow" . really disappointing, my husband who never makes a fuss, never doesn't  tip servers couldn't wait to leave, saying never again. Shame, we live 3 blocks away, we thought we'd found our regular.

I am still in shocked at how they treated us. We went for Valentine's Day and my friends food comes out 20 minutes pass and I am still without food, I reach out to the servers who in those 20 minutes still has not come to check on us, trying to be understanding that it's busy she says I can take your food of the bill, sure but I am still hungry I came to eat, she ends up taking the food of the bill  brings us the bill. My friends food was cold ended up getting it to go and I'm leaving without dinner and that's it's after we pay she ends up brings it wrapped to go and just dismissed us. I can't not believe we were treated so poorly.  The fact that we went there for dinner and left without being able to eat and they didn't acknowledge it, blows my mind. Worst experience at a restaurant ever!!!!!

The food is good however, we've gone there a couple of times and all those time we have to wait over 1 hour for the food. I don't care if the food is good, but the waiting time pisses me off. :) don't go there if you don't like waiting.

Well people, every time I've come to Osteria Brooklyn has been and awesome experience, Raffaele, chef/owner, creates every dish with his heart soul, and you can tell! It's like dying and going to haven! MUST TRY!

Amazing food!!! Love the service and ambiance here. My only tip here would be to get a table further away from the meat cutter. It gets really loud and is disruptive. Other than that I love this place!

Went for lunch with my wife, which wasn't that busy at all. The chef told my wife and I to sit at an outdoor table... completely ignored right after.. we even had to ask for menus. Walked out after 20 minutes of waiting for a waiter to even present themselves.

During covid times this place and Walters offer the best upscale food in the area. I had the osobucco and my gf had the gnocchi and both were amazing. I think I read that the head chef is a name in the industry which I totally believe based on the plates we had! Will need to come back for the pizza since it's so close to where I live.

3rd visit- I ordered the lasagna, it's not the lasagna you get typically, it's made with spinach dough, bechamel and bolognese. The meal was a  light version of what I expected,(not the heavy, roll me over type of lasagna) but it was delicious. This version was unique but not far off from traditional, that's what made it enjoyable. I'm still waiting to get to the desserts and brunch menus so l have to go back. They keep pulling me in. If you want  a good outdoor meal and great service, invite some friends, sit back and enjoy Osteria Brooklyn. 5 Stars to the the Chefs and the Staff
Delicious Italian food with fresh ingredients! Chef Raffaele knows how to take it to another level.  Great selection of wines too. Looking forward to trying other dishes on the menu!

This restaurant has amazing Italian food probably one of the best I've ever had but the hospitality is one of a kind. You are greeted by everyone in the front Chef Raffaele, Kendra, Anna even the back of the house. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming here. The Chef is always asking if everything is ok he really makes you feel like home. I bring all my friends here , I even throw parties in the garden because of how amazing the food is and the hospitality have to try the Burrata & Fig appetizer!

In my opinion, the best restaurant in Clinton Hill. The day I moved in I went there for dinner as it looked the most inviting, and it didn't disappoint. Been there several times since and the food is amazing. Haven't had something I haven't loved. They follow Covid precautions well which is important to me. The space is beautiful but most important, the service is superb. Everyone is always smiling. The owner is friendly and gives true Italian warm hospitality.. It's my go-to. And don't forget to try the crème brulee. You won't regret it.

My husband and I came here opening week because we watched the owners create such a cute outdoor set-up during Covid, and the charmers could not be denied! However, the main courses were disappointing. My husband had the cacio e pepe -- basically our favorite dish to get to test out any new Italian spot -- and it was flavorless. I had the osso buco that tasted like it was put in the pressure cooker for half an hour. We were upset to see a beautiful spot, have lack luster food.
No comment

The food is absolutely perfect (shoutout to the chefs)! We ordered oysters, lobster salad, grilled octopus, fried calamari and zucchini, the seafood pasta, the scallop risotto, and the tiramisu. All of it was beyond delicious! Service and the staff are excellent. We sat in the backyard and it was super cute!! Thank you for a lovely dining experience :)
Dynamite Italian spot! We had the octopus carbone and were blown away. Top notch outdoor (heated!) seating area. Coming back tomorrow night

Host and chef extraordinaire, Rafaelle continues to serve fantastic food in a friendly, cozy atmosphere.  Having enjoyed his talents at Maiella I was anxious to try his latest endeavor and boy, not only did he not disappoint but the food is even BETTER!  I admit I went overboard anxious to sample so many delicious sounding items.  Risotto with scallops, wine infused pasta and more blew me away.  I was also pleased to see the pricing.  The menu offers anything from super yummy pizza to over the top main courses.  And the desserts..OMG.  There's nothing like a fabulous meal with choices for the whole family served with warm Italian hospitality!  And no, I'm not related

This spot was absolutely amazing and I am so happy to be writing its first review on Yelp. Our food was fantastic and the staff were very friendly. I wish them success during these difficult times, hope to enjoy their food again soon.
Food was amazing. Service was excellent. So glad we stopped. The risotto is to die for. I had the mushroom and scallops, my wife had the shrimp risotto.

I'll keep this short. I love the set up and how clean everything is. Definitely awakens you to flavors never had before. Outright, I must say their service is impeccable Wish I could come here more often!

Excellent dining experience on all fronts. Friendly and attentive staff. Reasonable prices/portions. Every dish we had was delicious. Burrata wrapped with prosciutto and fig was the best I have had. Gnocchi with fresh shaved truffles was to die for. We walked away full and glowing.
Food was excellent.  Attentive service and a hospitable staff made the experience nice and personal.

Fabulous new place!  The food is delicious - Raffaello and his team provide terrific service and the food was excellent.  The antipasto was great - lots of cold cuts - the way I like it, several excellent cheeses.  Ordered the bucatini cacio pepe for my main - it was excellent.  Other choices in the group included pizza, lasagna, a pasta with scallops & funghi, and another pasta with funghi  & truffle sauce.  Everyone loved everything. Sampled an assortment of the desserts - my favorite was the mini  chocolates souffle, though the creme brule was also delicious.

This is one of the best restaurants i ever had.The food was great,service was amazing.We threw our wedding dinner here last night the chef treated us like family.We will def be back for future occasions.

Love this spot! We stumbled upon it and thought "oh looks cute, why not?"... we were so pleasantly surprised. The food is great, the vibe is amazing, and overall such an enjoyable afternoon. Will definitely be coming back.

RACIST! Black people stay away! DO NOT spend your money at this establishment, they don't want us here! The owner is very cold. He's judges you based on how much he thinks you're going to spend. We didn't like the energy he was giving off. We ended up leaving and taking our money to SOCO.

I planned my wife's 50th birthday dinner at this wonderful establishment.  I contacted the restaurant via e-mail through their website and requested an outside reservation for 12 and they quickly confirmed it.  The experience was top-notch from beginning to end.  My wife had an amazing time, as did all of our friends who joined us to celebrate.  The menu had tremendous variety - traditional dishes and along with more contemporary choices for those who like to try something new.   The food was excellent - terrific flavors and portions.  The wine list was also notable and reasonably priced.  Toward the end of the meal, the chef greeted us all, provided us with complimentary lemoncellos, and made my wife truly feel special.  I recommend this restaurant to any and all, whether you're looking for a romantic night out with your significant other or celebrating with a large group of friends and family.  You won't be disappointed.

Service and attitude can really make or break the dining experience. Unfortunately, both are lacking at Osteria. After being extremely patient with our server and service, I had to call the restaurant and let the owner know we were still waiting for TWO entrees at our table after only one was brought out. It took so long for service that the one entree that had come out was completely eaten by the time we had been fed up and called (by phone) to say our food had not come out. The server was apologetic and blamed this huge oversight on a large party. By that time we had been at the table for TWO hours, and could not stay to wait for the food to be prepared after waiting long periods of time between each interaction with the server. I said we would pay for whatever food came out and call it a day. The owner came to the table and asked if everything was okay (but knew it wasn't because I had spoke to him on the phone). When I said no, he put the blame on the server and said "he never put the order in" and WALKED AWAY! He didn't apologize or show any respect towards patrons of his restaurant. I would never come to this restaurant again or suggest it to anyone. The terrible service and the disregard for patrons is appalling. NEVER EATING HERE AGAIN!
No comment

Omg ..stop by this new restaurant...and  let me tell you something..we start with the caccio e peppe pasta ..out of this world the pasta is homemade..follow by the gr octopus omg fresh and tender delicious  finally i end up with the osobucco i lick the whole plate ...but the end was the best part ....we have the  italian meringue and homemade crembule..wow even the expresó was top of the line ...but the service is also unbelievable...the server's are very friendly always with smile  ..and also the best part the cheff owner cooks right in front of you..I definitely coming back ...love you guys ..keep the hard work
The staff, the aesthetic, but most importantly the food was a pure delight!! I will definitely be back here soon!

Without a doubt the very best Italian food in Brownstone Brooklyn. Their zuppetta di pesce outdoes any cioppino, any boulliabaisse--any fish soup I have ever had in my 63 years (many of those restaurant-going years). More kinds of freshest fish, with a broth that could serve as a meal itself. Try the polenta & funghi for a combination of silky richness with a savory heart. Whatever you do, do not leave without a piece of the meringue cake. No, you've never had meringue like this. Unless you had it here, again and again.
This place is really good. I got the spagetti fruttiare de mare and it was so gooood. The ratio of the seafood to the spaghetti was perfect. I'd definitely come back here.

A group of us dined there last night and had the most wonderful experience. The service and food were equally impeccable. We ordered the calamari, burratta, lamb shank, branzino, chicken parm and lasagna - all of which were a hit! The cocktails and wine selection were lovely and we ordered 6 of the 8 desserts and truly enjoyed them all. We can't say enough good things and can't wait to go back! I would highly encourage you to go!
You can taste the love that is put into the food here. It's nice to see, with everything that is going on, the level of quality you receive. Must try!!!
Great food and really warm, cozy, safe outdoor dining experience!  One of our favorites is the frito misto....and the bread basket!

We sat outside under a tent and had a great dinner. Very friendly and helpful staff and the Sardinian owner came over to talk. Amazing fall-off-the bone lamb with papparedelle noodles, a delicious peach and arugula salad and pizza with bacon, caraméliséd onions and egg. Highly recommend

Overall it was a really nice experience. The food was fantastic, the employees were very sweet, and the tables were spread apart enough for me to feel safe during Covid. Especially since we were seated in the backyard, I felt safe and away from the Myrtle crowd.

Wow. First let me just say that Osteria got the outdoor dining during Covid thing down perfectly!  They have made the outdoor dining in the street experience chic. What a well planned and tasteful use of space..from the canopy to the tables with umbrellas to the platform that keeps you from having to step down from the curb, they did a great job. The food was sensational. The seafood was super fresh and the back ribs with balsamic and cranberry...what a decadent treat. Don't miss out.

Just tried calling this place about six times to place an order for pick up. Keep being told I will be called back in five minutes. This has happened three times with no call back. The last time I just called the waitress said hold on and then hung up on me. They need to create a better system to take pick up orders or at least make some effort to answer the phone and stop hanging up on first time patrons. Pretty simple fix I think.
